job_description: Data Analyst - job post Blackwave Telecom, Inc. Irvine, CA 92618 • Hybrid remote $22.00 - $24.98 an hour -  Full-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $22.00 - $24.98 an hour Job Type Full-time Contract Description The Data Analyst is responsible for providing accurate, complete and meaningful reports and analysis used for business management and decision making. The Data Analyst works closely with department and/or functional managers to determine report requirements, build reports and quality test them prior to distribution. Essential Job Functions Develops and deploys reporting and analysis that is accurate, complete and properly summarized to aid in management of business and management decision making. Responsible for extracting and summarizing data from JDE, Oracle, and other corporate systems. Has basic knowledge of JDE tables and field usage. Has knowledge of Oracle tables and field usage. Has knowledge of other corporate software, programs and data tools. Assists managers with report design and development. Tests reports and ensures that they perform as expected. Understands flow of data internally and in relation to the General Ledger. Produces weekly, monthly, and quarterly trend and activity reports as well as other operational and management reports. Ensures that reports are produced per scheduled timelines for review by functional management teams. Analyzes data and investigates and researches anomalies. Works with department and/or functional teams to correct issues when identified. Produces ad-hoc reporting and support for projects as assigned. Education/Certifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Business, Accounting, Finance or related field Experience/Minimum Requirements Two (2) years Accounting/Finance/Business reporting and analysis experience Other Skills/Abilities Strong PC skills – excellent Excel knowledge Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to summarize large amounts of complex data into management reports Knowledge of JDE and other data analysis and financial software and tools Ability to problem solve to determine root causes of anomalies Understand and write reports using various software and tools Ability to prioritize and work well under pressure Working Conditions: Works in a normal office setting with no exposure to adverse environmental conditions. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $22.00 - $24.98 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Overtime Ability to commute/relocate: Irvine, CA 92618: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): Do you have two (2) years Accounting/Finance/Business reporting and analysis experience? Do you have knowledge of JDE and other data analysis and financial software and tools? Do you have the ability to summarize large amounts of complex data into management reports? Do you have strong PC skills and excellent Excel knowledge? Work Location: Hybrid remote in Irvine, CA 92618 Health insurance If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Epic Application Analyst - Technical (Pref: Provider MasterFile - Big Data) - job post Farid Consulting Los Angeles, CA 90013 • Hybrid remote $64,883 - $125,301 a year -  Full-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $64,883 - $125,301 a year Job Type Full-time Contract Highly Needed Skills: Epic Applications, Interfaces, Technical knowledge, SQL/Clarity Reporting, Advance Excel skills, Macros, Configuration Management, Data Modeling, Data Science, Python, Deep Healthcare Knowledge Create new SER records - Import/Export - Handing Big Data with SER Masterfiles. Establish new guidelines for build as new modules or systems are implemented SER Provider Master File Leagacy to Epic conversion - Implementation (Deep Healthcare Knowledge) + Data Modeling + Advance Excel Knowledge. Recommend policies and procedures that ensure efficient loading and streamlining of accurate provider information in EPIC. Troubleshoot issues related to a SER record/Provider Master File. Adjust database content to be consistent with federal and state laws, State policies and procedures, and requirements of various applications and systems using the data. Establish a process for inactivating SER records when appropriate as defined by the integrated needs. Lead projects. Coordinate load with other teams and systems. Test upgrade and enhancements released by the vendor. Test and validate new setting requests by other team member Epic Build: Epic Application Knowledge - Epic Tapestry UM/Referrals, EpicCare Ambulatory, Home Health, EpicCare Inpatient, Billing etc. Provides build required to support practices and departments. This includes building and/or configuring items in epic such as: facility, department and provider master files. Monitors email, workqueues and service center, for maintenance related build requests. Completes requests within department set guidelines. Reviews all build requests for appropriateness and assures standard processes are followed. Notifies Manager when requests are inappropriate. Reviews all build request for potential impact to downstream activities, such as billing. Documents all changes to Epic Production in a way that follows Epic standard processes. Assures that related build is consistent and follows standard processes. Is aware of enhancements that require changes to build processes. Analyzes system build for new optimizations and functionalities related to SER, DEP, EAF Masterfiles. Manage and prioritize requests for DEP records from various staff members in a timely and professional manner: Receive and process information from the Integrated DEP workgroup representatives including creation of new DEP records and updates to existing. Lead the DEP Workgroup to evaluate new DEP requests. Coordinate customer participation in the meetings as necessary Perform updates in a timely manner. Troubleshoot issues related to the DEP. Assist with verifying that request is appropriate. Maintain department Visio's with clear documentation. Test upgrade and enhancements released by the vendor. Develop workflows to optimize new functionality for the Masterfile Test and validate new setting requests by other team members. Manage and prioritize requests for new EAF records based on the needs of the Enterprise Develop an understanding of when a new EAF record is required for DEP build based on established EPIC policy. Receive and process information from when a new Place of Service is established. Perform updates in a timely manner. User Support: Provides support to Provider Masterfile + Epic Tapestry + Other Epic Applications. While working with end users, identifies potential difficulties in system build and process flow and works with Manager to develop proposals for lessening or avoiding them, including backup plans. Provides quality monitoring of system related functions. Communicates new functions to user community and assist in the implementation and training of those new functions, as well as writing of policies and procedures to use those new functions. Provide education about the master files to team members. Required Qualifications Master's degree in computer science, a related field, or a clinical field and 2 years work related experience in the information technology field or a combination of clinical or operational healthcare environments OR Bachelor's degree in computer science, a related field, or a clinical field and 4 years work related experience in the information technology field or a combination of clinical or operational healthcare environments OR Advance Technical Knowledge (SQL, Excel, Data Modeling, Handle Big Data, Import/Exports, Python) Job Related Knowledge: Demonstrated ability to independently prioritize projects. Previous experience in a large organization working with integrated systems. Understanding of Provider Master File (SER), EAF, EPT, ETX, HHS ++ INIs, billing/revenue cycle and how integration of other applications can affect the process. Knowledge of provider credentialing process and systems. Advanced knowledge of MS Excel Excellent data management skills Strong attention to detail & processes. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Excellent customer service and problem resolution skills. Ability to work autonomously, with a high level of accuracy and speed and exhibit a willingness to work with deadlines. Willingness to participate in a diverse team environment Must be able to perform the essential functions of the position with or without accommodation Preferred Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree with Data Management experience and Health Care exposure Experience: At least 5 year working knowledge of Epic Tapestry UM or EpicCare Ambulatory or Inpatient or Cadence, or Grand Central, or ADT/Prelude in a performance improvement setting. 3 years of experience with Data Modeling, Advance Excel, Handling big Data with Database ETL. 3 years experience of assessing and operationalizing ambulatory workflows in a healthcare setting Possesses strong presentation skills or public speaking experience to communicate information and ideas clearly, verbally and in writing. 2-3 years of data management experience with preference for Epic data experience Note: This is both Technical + Business Side role - Meeting the needed requirement is mandatory. A successful candidate will go through multiple rounds of interview (Technical, Business + Behavioral). Sounds Interesting - Send over your resume - email your resume to zsam@faridconsulting.com or Jobs@faridconsulting.com Call - 630-296-4621. Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $64,882.87 - $125,300.71 per year Benefits: 401(k) matching Schedule: 8 hour shift Application Question(s): Do you have experience with Big Data Handling? Healthcare Data Model? Do you have experience with Epic INIs? Implementation & Legacy Data Conversion to Epic System? You will have accountability over gathering critical program data through various areas, including customer feedback, creating, and tracking dashboards-based metrics, and monthly reports from both 3rd party implementers and internal teams. You will also have accountability over ensuring that trends in this data are correctly reported to both managers and contractors. Outside of data needs, this position will the crucial to the success of assigned programs by supplying Advisors and Senior Advisors with meeting materials based on synthesized insights, as well as taking diligent notes during meetings and summarizing takeaways. Business Analyst, (C2C) - job post Tech Holding Los Angeles, CA • Remote $45 - $60 an hour -  Part-time, Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $45 - $60 an hour Job Type Part-time Contract About us: Working at Tech Holding isn't just a job, it's an opportunity to be a part of something bigger. We are a full-service consulting firm that was founded on the premise of delivering predictable outcomes and high-quality solutions to our clients. Our founders and team members have industry experience and have held senior positions in a wide variety of companies – from emerging startups to large Fortune 50 firms – and we have taken our combined experiences and developed a unique approach that is supported by the principles of deep expertise, integrity, transparency, and dependability. The Role: We are seeking a Business Analyst to join our team either part-time for a 2-month or 6-month contract preferably (with potential for hire) in Los Angeles County. The successful candidate will have at least 3 years of Business Analyst experience and will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, creating user stories, and work closely with stakeholders. What you will do: Facilitate meetings with stakeholders to gather input, provide updates, and ensure requirements are clearly understood. Work closely with the UX team, engineering, and QA to ensure that product requirements are met and any issues are addressed in a timely manner. Write product requirements independently and work with the team to ensure their successful implementation. Utilize JIRA Software to track progress and communicate with team members. Qualifications At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst. Experience gathering and documenting BRDs or creating user stories. Experience with Salesforce Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience with JIRA Software. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
